1. The Great Pyramids of Giza
2. The Sphinx
3. Karnak Temple Complex
4. Valley of the Kings
5. Abu Simbel Temples
6. Luxor Temple 
7. Egyptian Museum in Cairo
8. Hatshepsut Temple
9. Philae Temple
10. Dendera Temple Complex.

I don't trust tour companies. Is it safe to explore these landmarks on my own?

Exploring historical landmarks in Egypt on your own is possible, but safety should always be a top priority. Egypt is generally a safe country for tourists, but there are some safety concerns to be aware of, such as pickpocketing and occasional instances of terrorism. It is recommended to take caution and stay aware of your surroundings when exploring on your own.

If you do decide to explore on your own, it is recommended that you hire a licensed tour guide to accompany you for safety reasons and to get the most out of your experience. Licensed tour guides can also provide valuable information about the history and culture of the landmarks you are visiting.

It is also important to research the landmarks you want to visit and plan your itinerary accordingly to ensure that you know their opening hours, visiting policies, and are able to navigate the area safely.

Overall, while it is possible to explore historical landmarks in Egypt on your own, hiring a licensed tour guide or going with a reputable tour company can help ensure your safety and enhance your overall experience.
Can you recommend any good places to eat near these landmarks? I want to try some authentic Egyptian cuisine.

Yes, there are various places to eat near these landmarks that offer authentic Egyptian cuisine. Here are a few recommendations:

1. Abou El Sid: This restaurant, located near the Pyramids of Giza in Cairo, offers traditional Egyptian cuisine such as stuffed pigeon, koshari and molokhiya.

2. Felfela: Located near the Egyptian Museum in Cairo, this restaurant is known for its falafel, taameya, and other Middle Eastern dishes.

3. Luxor Coffee Shop: Located near the Karnak Temple in Luxor, this restaurant offers affordable Egyptian and Middle Eastern cuisine.

4. Sofra: This restaurant is located near the Valley of the Kings in Luxor and offers traditional Egyptian cuisine like fattah and koshari.

5. Ali Baba: Located near Abu Simbel, this restaurant offers both Egyptian and international dishes.

6. Nubian House: This restaurant is located on Elephantine Island, near Philae Temple in Aswan, and offers traditional Nubian cuisine such as stuffed pigeon and fish.

These are just a few of the many restaurants in and around the landmarks that offer authentic Egyptian cuisine. It is always a good idea to ask locals or hotel staff for additional recommendations.
